title: [To rel/1.2] add lazy page reader for aligned page reader to avoid huge memory cost when reading rows of aligned timeseries
body:
## Description
Same as PR https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10966

title: Accelerate the deletion execution
body:
## Description

This PR is improving the deletion speed of the following scenario.

There are 6 tsfiles with 500,000 devices belong to one database named `root.sg`. Then the execution of `delete from root.sg.**` will take **77 hours**...

The key point of this optimization is passing the the pattern `root.sg.**` directly to DataRegion layer, and if `root.sg` is the database name, we don't need to do the pattern match process. 

After this optimization, the execution time will be decreased to **20 seconds**.

title: add lazy page reader for aligned page reader to avoid huge memory cost when reading rows of aligned timeseries
body:
## Description
In this PR, we add a new implementation of IPageReader to get rid of huge memory cost when reading rows of aligned timeseries.
The newly added `LazyLoadAlignedPagePointReader` will construct row one by one as needed rather than deserializing all data points of one page in memory.

Depending on `LazyLoadAlignedPagePointReader`, the memory cost of compaction for aligned chunks will decreased a lot because the data points of one Page of all chunks won't be cached in memory when doing compaction.

title: [To rel/1.1] Rewrite compaction memory estimator
body:
## Description
1. Add ReadChunkInnerCompactionEstimator, FastCompactionInnerCompactionEstimator.
2. Delete ReadPointCrossCompactionEstimator and InplaceCompactionEstimator.
3. Add FastCrossSpaceCompactionEstimator.

title: Bump word-wrap from 1.2.3 to 1.2.5 in /iotdb-connector/grafana-plugin
body:
Bumps [word-wrap](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/word-wrap) from 1.2.3 to 1.2.5.
Release notes

Sourced from word-wrap's releases.

1.2.5

Changes:

Reverts default value for options.indent to two spaces ' '.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jonschlinkert/word-wrap/compare/1.2.4...1.2.5

1.2.4

What's Changed

  • Remove default indent by @​mohd-akram in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#24
  • 🔒fix: CVE 2023 26115 (2) by @​OlafConijn in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#41
  • :lock: fix: CVE-2023-26115 by @​aashutoshrathi in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#33
  • chore: publish workflow by @​OlafConijn in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#42

New Contributors

  • @​mohd-akram made their first contribution in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#24
  • @​OlafConijn made their first contribution in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#41
  • @​aashutoshrathi made their first contribution in jonschlinkert/word-wrap#33

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jonschlinkert/word-wrap/compare/1.2.3...1.2.4

Commits
  • 207044e 1.2.5
  • 9894315 revert default indent
  • f64b188 run verb to generate README
  • 03ea082 Merge pull request #42 from jonschlinkert/chore/publish-workflow
  • 420dce9 Merge pull request #41 from jonschlinkert/fix/CVE-2023-26115-2
  • bfa694e Update .github/workflows/publish.yml
  • ace0b3c chore: bump version to 1.2.4
  • 6fd7275 chore: add publish workflow
  • 30d6daf chore: fix test
  • 655929c chore: remove package-lock
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: [auth] Adaptation of schema query authentication interface
body:
## Description


The upper level needs to call `setAuthorityScope()` to set the appropriate authority pattern. defaults is ALL_MATCH_SCOPE(root.**). Related statement to implement:

- show/count timeseries
  - ShowTimeSeriesStatement
  - CountTimeSeriesStatement
  - CountLevelTimeSeriesStatement
- show view
  - ShowLogicalViewStatement
- show/count device
  - ShowDevicesStatement
  - CountDevicesStatement
- show/count database
  - ShowDatabaseStatement
  - ShowTTLStatement
  - CountDatabaseStatement
- show paths set template
  - ShowPathSetTemplateStatement
- show path using template
  - ShowPathsUsingTemplateStatement
- show/count child nodes
  - ShowChildPathsStatement
  - ShowChildNodesStatement

title: IOTDB. auth refine.
body:
In this pr:
1. 添加新的权限类型，并将权限以是否与路径相关进行分类：系统权限、序列权限。
2. 为权限检查、展示等提供接口实现。
3. 将权限模块转换为内存结构，载入权限信息后，在内存中进行操作，并利用共识层日志进行文件状态的维护。
4. 为datanode 权限模块添加 token alive 时间，结合心跳与 procedure 保证缓存有效。
5. 为没有 UT 的模块部分添加测试。

title: [IOTDB-6125] Fix DataPartition allocation bug when insert big batch data
body:
The DataPartitions will be allocated un-balanced if the user insert a big batch data to the cluster firstly. Because the RegionGroup quickly-extension-policy doesn't extend enough RegionGroups for the special case.

In this PR, the RegionGroup extension policy will always ensure the database have enough RegionGroups for allocate new Partitions balancely.

And this PR also add some concise log to record the DataAllotTable

title: [To rel/1.2] [IOTDB-6125] Fix DataPartition allocation bug when insert big batch data
body:
The DataPartitions will be allocated un-balanced if the user insert a big batch data to the cluster firstly. Because the RegionGroup quickly-extension-policy doesn't extend enough RegionGroups for the special case.

In this PR, the RegionGroup extension policy will always ensure the database have enough RegionGroups for allocate new Partitions balancely.

And this PR also add some concise log to record the DataAllotTable

body: The following commits are optimizations for OOM problems with mods files

title: Pipe: Swapped the start order of realtimeExtractor and historicalExtractor to avoid losing data
body:
## Description
Swapped the startup sequence of realtimeExtractor and historicalExtractor to avoid possible data loss.

<!--
In each section, please describe design decisions made, including:
 - Choice of algorithms
 - Behavioral aspects. What configuration values are acceptable? How are corner cases and error 
    conditions handled, such as when there are insufficient resources?

title: [To rel/1.2][IOTDB-6114] Pipe: Support multi-cluster data sync (#10868)
body: cherry pick from #10868.

title: [IOTDB-6082] Improve disk space metrics
body:
## Description

Support hot reload data dir in SystemMetrics.

title: [IOTDB-6125] Fix DataPartition allocation bug when insert big batch data
body:
The DataPartitions will be allocated un-balanced if the user insert a big batch data to the cluster firstly. Because the RegionGroup quickly-extension-policy doesn't extend enough RegionGroups for the special case.




In this PR, the RegionGroup extension policy will always ensure the database have enough RegionGroups for allocate new Partitions balancely.




And this PR also add some concise log to record the DataAllotTable

title: Optimize client cpp distribution packaging
Take all Drivers of one FragmentInstance into account when estimating memory usage of FI
Revert removed dependencies to avoid write performance declining
[IOTDB-6124] Add scope filter parameter for tree visitor framework
body:
## Description

With the introduction of the authorization module, traversal of the MTree may no longer be a search of the whole tree.

Fortunately, the PathPatternTree for authorization must consist of either a prefix or a fullPath. For example, `root.db.d1.s1` or `root.db.d2.**`. Therefore, we only need access to the subtree identified by the authorized PathPatternTree.

The PathPatternTree of authorization can be easily converted to a deterministic automaton (DFA). In the MTree visitor framework, we can introduce a new member variable `scopeDFA` to restrict the search scope. Pruning will be done early when the search exceeds the `scopeDFA`.

title: [IOTDB-6123] Pipe: reduce the de/ser to slove the slow log transfer problem
body: ## Description As you can see from the graph, WAL's serialization and deserialization consume a lot of CPU, about 25%, which becomes the focus of our optimization attention. ## Solution We perform the following optimizations for log mode: * When no pattern is set, i.e., the extractor's default pattern is used, we don't need to serialize and deserialize the WAL, but instead transfer the read binary data directly to the receiver * Expansion of allocated memory

title: [IOTDB-6122] Pipe: Progress Index markers an incorrect value when load a tsfile with tsfileResource
body:
## Description
When we load a tsfile , if it has a tsFileResource, there are two cases in tsFileResource: 
 1. it doesn't have a progress index, we just give it one from system.
 2. it has a progress index, the index shouldn't be loaded, it should be **recovered** instead of updating.

title: Allow `\``*`\``  in DevicePath
body:
`*` doesn't mean *, so use String.constains to do that judgement is incorrect. Actually, we don't need to do that if statement at all in write case.

to replay, you can simply use the following sql:

```
insert into root.db.`d1*2`(time,s1) values(1,1);
```

title: [To rel/1.2] fix wal npe when memTable has flushed.
body: wal obtains IMemTable from memTableInfo twice when deleting obsolete files. The IMemTable is not null when it is obtained the first time, but the imemtable may have been flushed when it is obtained the second time. As a result, the obtained value is null, resulting in NPE

title: fix wal npe when memTable has flushed.
body: wal obtains IMemTable from memTableInfo twice when deleting obsolete files. The IMemTable is not null when it is obtained the first time, but the imemtable may have been flushed when it is obtained the second time. As a result, the obtained value is null, resulting in NPE

title: Override existing jar instead of deleting it when registering UDF

title: Fixed the windows build of the cpp-example
[IOTDB-6120] Push down limit/offset in query with group by time
body:
desgin doc: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/TAsXd5hdZoVevrxqqgtcg9A9nhf

This PR optimized the performance of query by pushing down limit/offset when there is`group by time` clause in SQL.

We have created 10 devices and inserted 100,000 records for each device with timestamps incrementing from 0, 1, 2, and so on, to test performance. The execution times for different SQL queries before and after optimization are recorded in the following table:
<byte-sheet-html-origin data-version="4" data-is-embed="true" data-grid-line-hidden="false">

sql | original | optimized | orginal(dop=1) | optimized(dop=1) | explain
-- | -- | -- | -- | --| --|
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 100 limit 10 | 10.29 | 3.06 | 26.86 |  5.19 | Transfer group by time to ((10000,11000],100ms)
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) order by time limit 10 offset 100 | 10.48 | 3.11 | 26.82 | 5.34 | The same as above
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) order by time desc limit 10 offset 100 | 10.50 | 3.36 | 28.61 | 6.13 | Transfer group by time to ((89000,90000],100ms)
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 2000 limit 10 | 10.07| 3.49 | 27.21 | 4.39 | The `offset` skipped all the data, resulting in an empty result set.
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) order by count(num) limit 10 offset 100 | 11.59 | 11.07 | 27.13 | 27.14 | Using `order by` clause other than "order by time" does not allow for query optimization through query pushdown, so the normal query process is followed |
select count(*) from root.sg.d0 group by ((0,100000],100ms) order by count(num) desc limit 10 offset 100 | 10.44 | 11.03 | 27.41 | 27.58 | The same as above
select count(*) from root.** group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 1100 limit 4200 align by device | 48.13 | 37.35|144.57|122.11|Optimized 10 devices to device1 to device5.
select count(*) from root.** group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 1100 limit 200 align by device | 23.51 | 6.38 |43.11|9.75| Optimized to group by time((10000, 30000], 100ms) for device1, while getting rid of the other 9 devices.
select count(*) from root.** group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 1100 limit 20 align by device | 18.38 | 4.57 |42.77|5.74|Optimized to group by time((10000, 12000], 100ms) for device1, while getting rid of the other 9 devices.
select count(*) from root.** group by ((0,100000],100ms) offset 100 align by device | 57.69 | 59.57|246.58|246.47| The result set includes data from all devices.
</byte-sheet-html-origin>

From the performance test results, it can be observed that optimized code for queries with time parameter pushdown achieves better performance. Additionally, even in cases where parameter pushdown is not feasible, stable performance is ensured. In the context of "align by device," discarding devices also leads to objective performance enhancement. When no devices are discarded, the original performance can still be maintained.

## Description


In PB_Tree mode, when a SchemaRegion is deleted, the corresponding MTree needs to be deleted, and all references holding MTreeStore need to be released so that the deprecated objects can be GC.

title: [RatisConsensus] Unify read timeout to Thrift connection timeout
body:
Currently RatisConsensus supports read timeout.
We should let it be consistent with our default request timeout, i.e. Thrift connection timeout.

title: [IOTDB-6117] Pipe: Optimize RPC requests from cn to dn
body: Currently, cn sends pipeMeta of all existing pipes to each dn upon create/start/stop/drop pipe, which may be time-comsuming. In this PR, cn will send exactly one pipeMeta to each dn upon create/start/stop/drop pipe.

title: Implement intersect with prefix pattern for PartialPath and PathPatternTree
body:
## Description

To support authorization, this PR implements two algorithms about intersection.

* PartialPath
```java
  /**
   * Generate a list of partial paths which are the intersection of this path pattern and input
   * prefix pattern.
   *
   * @param prefixPattern must be a prefix full path ending with one "**", like "root.sg.**"
   * @return a list of partial paths which are the intersection of this path pattern and input
   *     prefix pattern.
   */
  public List<PartialPath> intersectWithPrefixPattern(PartialPath prefixPattern);
```

* PathPatternTree
```java
  /**
   * Intersect the pattern tree with the full path prefix tree, and return the intersected pattern
   * tree.
   *
   * @param patternTree any pattern tree
   * @param fullPathPrefixTree the included pattern must be fullPath or prefix pattern(e.g.
   *     root.sg.**)
   * @return the intersected pattern tree
   */
  public static PathPatternTree intersectWithFullPathPrefixTree(PathPatternTree patternTree, PathPatternTree fullPathPrefixTree);
```

title: reduce wal log output level
body: info logs are often printed unnecessarily when no outdated WAL files have been deleted. This fix will reduce the log level to debug. In addition, some optimization of the printed log content.
